main event: A USAF intelligence officer observed an unidentified aerial object near Wiesbaden Air Base in Germany on July 27, 1950.
interesting points: The object was circular and resembled an automobile headlight tinted so that a portion of the under-elliptical axis.
The object accelerated and leveled off at a lower altitude, continuing on a straight course.
The two control tower operators on duty at the time did not observe any means of propulsion and could not state the direction of the object's disappearance.
A separate incident was reported where a pilot was hit by a 'flying saucer' the size and shape of a football over Springfield, Illinois, which then bounced off the plane without causing damage.
A woman reported seeing the object in the Illinois incident, describing it as a 'flying saucer'.
sighted object: Circular object resembling an auto headlight
witnesses: USAF intelligence officer, control tower operators
